title: Security Device Manager - OS Client Cert Module
content:
OS Client Cert Module not installed/loaded after clean installation of Thunderbird version 115.3.1. The osclientcerts.dll is present in the Thunderbird program directory. Trying to load the dll in the Security Device Manager does not work.

Is there a way to manually add the security module to the configuration file or registry?
creator: steven.wright

title: Email not working after update to SuperNova?  Multiple - gmail, dreamhost, frontier etc
content: bold textAfter the Thunderbird update to Supernova none of my emails work - including gmail, local risebroadband.net, frontier, and dreamhost. All worked prior to the update. I cannot enter my risebroadband as new and get to work either??? Any suggestions? THanks.
creator: marcyslawrence

title: Lost current profile data
content: I did a dumb thing. I transferred my TB (v 115.3.1 64) Profiles folder to OneDrive because I couldn't find a way to automatically back it up. However I wasn't able to make TB work so I transferred it back into Appdata\Roaming\Thunderbird. Now when I open TB, it has an old folder structure and emails up to 2020 but nothing beyond in any folder. The default profile is big, 25 GB or so. The setup is fine as it connects to my ISP and downloads current emails and those stored on the server. How can I recover the recent profile?
creator: rosseddy

title: Favourites/Favorites Folder isn't showing selected favourited folders
content: I created some Saved Search folders which I marked as Favourite folders and they appeared in the Favourite Folder section. I then quit Thunderbird 115 and later reopened Thunderbird to find that those folders are no longer appearing in the Favourite Folders section yet they are still marked as Favourite folders.
creator: andrew6

title: support options
content: I realize that this forum is made up of Mozilla users. Is there any way to reach any type of support person at Mozilla (specifically for Thunderbird)? What does one do when no one has an answer, or even a suggestion, on how to fix a problem? Is there any way to contact Mozilla, either to ask questions or to make suggestions?
creator: hockeycat

title: My emails are sending vacation response to senders
content: my emails are sending a reply to senders saying vacation response? how do I stop this?
creator: peaceomind

title: I don't understand. Thunderbird changes, and there's no way to contact the people who made the changes?
content: The system is worse; it makes me wait a long time when I didn't have to wait before. Noone answers.
creator: ErictheGreen

title: Some emails not being marked as read (v118.0.1)
content:
Since installing the new version of ThunderBird I find that some messages are not automatically marked as read immediately. If I wait long enough they do get marked, but if I'm skipping through promotional stuff they just don't get automatically marked as read. Messages that have been sitting in the list unread for a day or two are affected the same as recently arrived messages.

I think it might have something to do with the affected messages containing lots of links, e.g. advertising material from supermarket chains.

In Settings I have "Automatically mark messages as read" - "Immediately on display".
creator: Jay.Dear

title: Thunderbird update 115.3.1 self installed now nothing works
content: Thunderbird update 115.3.1 self installed now nothing works. When I first opened program after update and tried to retrieve mail for one account (of5) got a window telling me password not accepted by pop server (at zoho.com) and asking if i wished to enter a new one. Said no and went to passwords in config to check if they had transferred properly. They had. Tried again to download messages with same results (password not accepted)and clicked to enter new one. Instead window popped up for next account telling me password not accepted by server and did I want to enter a new one. Same results for every account in order without ever letting me access one. Rebooted - no change. Downloaded copy from mozilla and re-installed thinking it may reconfigure what was wrong. No luck. Now when I try to retrieve messages I don't even get password not accepted only "done" in bottom left corner where it usually shows download happening. I have used Thunderbird practically since it came out and have installed configured and transferred accounts across many computers and never had any problem like this!
creator: divideweb

title: emails automatically being deleted
content:
Emails that I receive in Mail for Windows, when deleted, also delete the same email from Thunderbird, but not the other way around.

How do I stop this and recover those lost emails?
creator: thewainwrights

title: Thunderbird E-mail cannot connect to outlook.com account
content:
ERROR From Microsoft. Account is at outlook.com. Using Firefox browser. Standard Security setting.

We can't sign you in Your browser is currently set to block cookies. You need to allow cookies to use this service.

Just started this evening. Just got upgraded to Thunderbird version 115.3.1 on one machine. Second machine still running version 105.13.0 with no issues. Both machines are Windows 11 Home Ver 22H2
creator: FDReynolds
